item.content:encoded:
Team Building Exercise

The trainer said,

                     Sit here and read
                     this page, right now.
                     And let the page come into you–
                     then, it will be true.

So we read aloud this theme,
Theme for English B,
us bunch of squares, arranged
around a conference table.
Who is this man and what
does he care about
what we read or how we think?
We shrugged and picked our teeth.

We sat and stared
out the window
or at the walls, never at
each other, lost
in a confluence of thought
about what it means to be
a colored student, twenty-two,
from Winston-Salem
and that the truth
might come out of you.

It is not so simple.

Someone finally said What
is the use? Or maybe that was me
lamenting in my head
the paltry power of poetry
to get at Blackness or Whiteness,
to get at all that’s meant
to be read out loud
inside this Theme.

The clock ticked off another hour,
we shuffled the papers into a pile
and drifted back to work. Black words
on a white page, colored, just the same
as when we came: a page for English B.

item.title: 124 – When Jesus Come
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: When Jesus Come Sharp end of the stick I got rubbing in my eye tonight. It burns & bores a hole & there ain’t much to be done. Sharp end of the stick I got rubbing in my old eye … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
When Jesus Come

Sharp end of the stick I got
rubbing in my eye tonight.
It burns & bores a hole
& there ain’t much to be done.
Sharp end of the stick I got
rubbing in my old eye tonight
but it’s Glory Hallelujah
when Jesus come.

Broken bit of a pot I got
scraping my poor sores.
Blood & ashes run down
my arms, run a dirty river.
Broken bit of of a pot I got
scraping away at these sores
but it’s Glory Hallelujah
when Jesus come.

Sackcloth on my back I got
to cover up my nakedness.
Itch & burn, rend & tear
& dust upon my head.
Sackcloth on my back I got
to weep my falling tears
but it’s Glory Hallelujah
when Jesus come.

When Jesus come on Judgement Day
it’s Glory Hallelujah.
This broken body rolled aside,
the tomb an empty hole,
every tear wiped away in the blink of an eye
for it’s glory, glory Hallelu,
when Jesus come on Judgement day.

item.title: 123 – Land of Enchantment
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Land of Enchantment Wine trips a switch, turns on the gene my grandfather begat my uncle and I before he died. Brain cancer. Years later: he raging incoherent in the middle of the night; me a sad little mollusk on … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Land of Enchantment

Wine trips a switch,
turns on the gene
my grandfather begat
my uncle and I
before he died.
Brain cancer.

Years later:
he raging incoherent
in the middle of the night;
me a sad little mollusk
on the phone, afraid
he’ll find us, smash
down the door. Monster
I never knew. I swore: never.

Now a tannic bloom a tumor
at my chest, creeps
up my neck. Keeps me
company. Soft sway
if I stand too quick crash
to sleep & wake early
without dreaming
of monsters or men.

They’re gone now. One
to the Land of Enchantment,
or Denver, San Francisco, Michigan,
who knows; Grandpa buried
with the horses. I drink
to remember the blood
I don’t know, to forget
the blood I am.

item.title: 122 – When
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: When What’s a boy to do when his best friend’s a unicorn? When his wife goes two knuckles deep at work but never comes close at home? When the God he signed on for gets rough, like a sea he … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
When

What’s a boy to do
when his best friend’s
a unicorn? When his wife
goes two knuckles deep
at work but never comes
close at home? When
the God he signed on for
gets rough, like a sea
he can’t calm, though
he has all the verses memorized?
What then? When his loved
brother is sinking, when
the cancer won’t quit, when the men
locked up are only getting out
to get locked up again, when the planet
slowly imploding despite us?
What then? When wars cease
to end. When hearts and minds
are not won, but broken. What about
when the dead rise up
and won’t leave? When love
does and won’t quit doing.
What then? What then?

item.title: 121 – IED

item.content:encoded:
IED

Imagine your soft body
of shrapnel

a mass
of foreign entities

waiting
to explode

sharp & cutting
nails

bones teeth slate
-colored eyes

not yet formed
but conceived

of screaming
into the world

item.title: 120 – Beget
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Beget God in His wisdom made sex a red light blurring the mind and its eye so we might forget or deny His intended consequences. So fraught.
item.content:encoded:
Beget

God in His wisdom
made sex

a red light
blurring

the mind
and its eye

so we might
forget

or deny
His intended

consequences.
So fraught.

item.title: 119 – A Startling Question
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: A Startling Question Is it auto- cannibalism if you chew the skin of your fingertips or bite your nails down to the quick as I sometimes do when frightened or nervous or angry or bored in a meeting or driving … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
A Startling Question

Is it auto-
cannibalism
if you chew
the skin
of your fingertips
or bite
your nails
down to the quick
as I sometimes do
when frightened
or nervous
or angry
or bored in a meeting
or driving long distances
or watching a movie
or surviving wedding toasts
or floating down a river
or talking with a friend through his troubles
or thoughtfully
composing a poem?

item.title: 118 – Original Sin
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Original Sin The Thai place on the corner I never remember the names of is closed again. A sign in the window announces Classic Thai Restaurant open soon! I ponder dried Thai chilies and ginger slivers, coconut curry blooming white … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Original Sin

The Thai place on the corner

I never remember the names of

is closed again. A sign in the window

announces Classic Thai Restaurant

open soon! I ponder

dried Thai chilies

and ginger slivers, coconut curry

blooming white and green.

How many ways are there to make pho?

Sticky rice is sticky rice is sticky rice.

When I get home I’ll find

a small white wax-lined box

at the back of the fridge, hidden

for a week behind the milk and pickles.

The noodles with spicy broccoli–

three chilies–could be from any shop.

The rice will be dried out, a granular brick stuck

to the bottom of the container.

I know this will not end well.

It never does. I regret the decision I’ve made,

have made a thousand times.

I’ll eat it anyway.

item.content:encoded:
“bright burning Christ”

bright burning Christ

leaded and stained white

darker colors hum

sun you carved, star

a thing we know

every element of

but never hold

its radiant light

broken lovely

so effortlessly

as you

item.title: 116 – Grief (for KG)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Grief In what boxes are we to bury dead marriages, once vacant tombs found filled? What solemn graveside eulogies do we recite for empty nests, for failed friends? What graves? Look close: how empty is Chiron’s boat, riding high at … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Grief

In what boxes are we to bury

dead marriages, once vacant

tombs found filled?

What solemn graveside

eulogies do we recite

for empty nests,

for failed friends?

What graves?

Look close: how empty

is Chiron’s boat,

riding high at anchor

on the far shore.
